text: We ate there last night. What a rip off! They overcharged us for a small bottle of saki and the sushi was not fresh. The first bartender kept saying this isn't his normal post and he wanted to be elsewhere. The girl bartender that took over was nice. They need to stop ripping people off by overcharging for saki and they need to make sure the fish is actually fresh. We will definitely not return. My advice, don't waste your money or time.

The food was all right. I ordered a nabeyaki and the soup was warm not hot as it should be.    Our waitress Mai or Betty as her name tag said, was very abrupt and acted like she hated her job.   The only time I saw a semblance of a smile was when she presented our check.   I have had her serve me numerous times and it is always the same.   Perhaps she's an owner which is why she can get away with this terrible attitude.

What a disgraceful meal we had last Saturday night. OMG....from the fatty uneatable short ribs to the multiple bones in the black cod.  Not right.  The sushi is most definitely bought from a grocery store as the rice was matted and wet.  On a good note the Edemame were good.....WOW...two thumbs down and very overpriced.

This is a beautiful restaurant unfortunately the sushi tastes like it came from a grocery store. My roll included what was supposed to be crab on the top. It was crab like but was definitely not crab.

The wife and I were staying at the Golden a Nugget and went for a late night snack. The sushi chef, Brian, was very nice and we had a good chat. The rolls were fine and the miso soup was good. The friendly service got it an extra star.

I tried Golden Nugget's new sushi restaurant based off its Yelp reviews, and man am I glad I did.  

Pros: Both their unique dishes and their simple sushi pieces were incredible, hands down the best sushi I've had all year.  Prices were reasonable for an upscale sushi restaurant.  Decent service, good sake selection and cool interior.

Con: My only issue was that it is open to the casino floor.  The trendy interior clashed with the tacky slot machines.

Go see Brian!  Especially if you are visiting from Hawaii, he knows how to make the sushi Hawaiian style.  We've been walking by the restaurant for a week and finally decided to stop in for dinner and I'm so glad we did.

Thanks for the awesome meal Brian!  We will keep an eye out for you when we come back!
After hearing good things, we were excited to try this place...but it ended up being very mediocre and way too expensive. Stay away unless you are dying for sushi.
J'ai commandé une soupe won ton et c'était assez ordinaire pour 12$. Très mauvais service également.
Rainbow roll was good.  Hamachi nigiri was excellent and the gyoza was most excellent bro!!!
Loved the experience and atmosphere was very delightful. The food was excellent and the waiters were at our fingertips. You wanted something,they give it to you.

Not that impressed.  Their sushi wasn't anything really special and the service was extremely slow even though we were practically the only people in there.  Basically they are over priced for the quality and service you are getting.

Worst service I've ever had in any restaurant. Absolutely no attention to the customers and the food it's self wasn't anything anything to rave about. The Environment was just gross and it wreaked of smoke. And yes vegas it's typical for places to smell of smoke but the place you go to dinner should not.
Not sure where the 2-3 stars come from. Our meal was ridiculous.  Blue fine spicy tuna? awesome!!

Red sushi sounds spicy, hunger inspiring and bull-exciting.
The sushi is unimpressive, small and almost tasteless. The fish was not quite fresh, the grade of ahi they were using was pink almost tombo. Tombo is definitely NOT red. Of all the sushi we ordered, nothing wa red. If not for the glasses of water, itd be fairly safe to bring your pet bull along.
The hot food is pretty good, but it is pricey! I ate the salmon, misoyaki butterfish and soft shell crab. Half of the soft-shell was near the size of my hand, the largest I've ever seen! And there was a spot of Kara-oroshi on the corner of my plate, I finally found some red, but it ended up being more oroshi, as it wasn't really spicy.

We were not going to eat here because of the gougy prices but we were both craving sushi we went here to eat because it is inside the hotel we stayed in. We were very put-off by the $6 miso soup and the $7 seaweed salad! Most of your Japanese favorites were predictably OK. I ordered some uni nigiri but about a half hour into the meal the waitress returned to let me know they were out of it. The sushi and sashimi were tasty and fresh but nothing special. The soft shell crabs were dripping with cooking oil and not as tasty or juicy as we get in NJ. They made me hurl my guts up as soon as I could get to my room. I can now say with a degree of expertise that the worst thing to throw up is raw fish. There was an extremely obnoxious table of two couples seated next to us- they were very very drunk and screaming at each other and discussing bodily functions. Otherwise, the room was pretty empty and it was LOUD because it is on the casino floor. Like other open restaurants in casinos, the smell of cigarettes wafts in as you walk inside. I would not eat here again, especially because there are so many really good and more authentic sushi restaurants to choose from in Las Vegas.

http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g45963-d2155064-r323046665-RED_SUSHI-Las_Vegas_Nevada.html#

Although the atmosphere is ehh the spicy tuna roll and the toro (tuna belly fat) really hit the spot. It's no nobu but when you have no other option at the time besides chicken fingers and mozzarella sticks at the other restaurants nearby, you have to take what you can get.

I was excited to take my parents here while they were in town visiting. We were sat right away and the appetizers we got were good. HOWEVER, then we got part of our dinner, a chicken teriyaki roll and we noticed the middle of the chicken was completely raw. Raw fish is one thing, raw chicken is another. They paid for the roll but still, can't imagine ever going back.

Well... The chef was very nice and the waitress kept our water filled.  However the food was lacking... The rice in the tuna rolls was a bit stale.  The rocking pop roll actually had the pop rock candy on top, not my idea of a sushi topper.  The fact that everything was expensive just made it harder to swallow.  I'll have to pass on this place next time I'm back in town.
Ate here twice. Average sushi but good for a casino downtown. Place is open to interior so like on a busy night it gets very loud.

I was robbed by this restaurant and quite frankly am tired of giving shitty reviews in this town. Went here the night of 2/13/14 to beat the crowds on valentines day. 

Should have stayed home. 

Showed up for dinner. 

Was forced to seat myself. 

The waitress didn't even say hello. She immediately started trying to sell me on expensive hot saki bottles. (Who the hell drinks hot saki anymore?) what happened to hello my name is....

Then we are rushed to order our dinner. 

The main course came out before the appetizers. I mentioned it to our waitress and she said... "Oh you like to order appetizer?" Was this bitch serious? Just moments before she had taken my order. 

The service is horrible and the food is grocery store quality. 

If you want a good sushi meal go to all you can eat at sushi mon or The one on rainbow. 

My bill was 79.99. I left 80. 

This was the first  time in my life I did not leave 20%.  

Red I hate you and will tell everyone how bad your service and food is. Currently I'm sitting on the toilet crapping out your poison.

If your in the Nugget craving raw fish and you can not get to another spot in town this is fine.  Certainly not the best sushi I have eaten by a long stretch.  This is not budget sushi by a long shot.  We actually left hungry cause we didn't want to spend any more money.  Service was good.

The service was terrible, the bartender forgot to make our drinks, the server didn't even notice and let the food come to the table with no drinks. I don't care that it was near close, unless the price drops bc it's it's late and they don't feel like providing decent service, the quality of service needs to be maintained. Our server didn't even come to ask how our food was till it was almost gone. My girl friend can not use chop sticks, she had to eat with her hands bc the server literally didn't care how our experience was.

Nice happy hour menu. 

Service by bartenders and cooks - very good. 
Service by wait staff - GEEZ ! CAN YOU MOVE ANY SLOWER? The old gal in her little scooter moved faster than this wait staff. 

The pork belly is overrated and over cooked. The garlic edamame was tasty. 

A great place for happy hour - ONLY!
Best sushi ever!! This place made me fall in love with sushi in the first place, and I return 6 years later to find that they still impress!!!

Terrible service!!! 
3 of us stood at the front waiting to be seated, as 3 waitresses walked past and never acknowledged us.  As we waited for 15 mins, I became very impatient from thier attitudes so I stopped a waitress named Betty and asked how do we order 2 bowls of miso soup.  She decided to take down our order, and I advised her we would sit at the bar.  I never saw her placed our order, so after another 15 min. I asked the bartender if 2 miso soups orders were placed and how long is the wait.  He camed back and advised us that Betty never put in the order.  I could understand if there was a line of customers or the placed was really crowded, but it was neither,  she was just plain rude!  
Once the bartender placed our order, she handed us our soup and never apologized nor explained to us why she failed to put the order in.  We vowed never to go back nor recommend this place to family or friends.  Customer service is very important! I can't believe Golden Nugget have people like this working there.

On our last night in Vegas, we decided to get our sushi on near Fremont Street. We had just arrived when happy hour was ending so we took advantage of multiple spicy tuna rolls to fill us up for the night. The sushi is fresh and exquisite. I highly recommend expanding your palette and challenge yourself to try something new. I am a big fan of eel and my meal was prepared to perfection. The display itself was pure art and I absolutely admire a chef that can make any dish look like a painting. If you find yourself stumbling around Fremont and you got the sushi crave--this is the go to spot.

Hidden away in the back of the Golden Nugget is a small sushi bar that's big on taste. Because "sushi" is part of the name, my husband decided to order a dragon roll, and we split some sashimi (eel and hamachi). But they also have a larger menu that includes my favorite fish--black cod (aka butterfish)--so of course I had to order that as my entree.

The fish was delicious and attractively plated atop grilled onions with mushrooms and tomatoes. Although the accompaniments weren't traditionally Asian, they fit well with the fish and didn't steal the thunder from the well-balanced protein.

I still love black cod (and I loved it there), but I was really impressed with the sashimi. Both the eel and the hamachi were fresh and flavorful, and the portion size was just right (4 large slices per order). In fact, the hamachi was among the best I've had! The dragon roll could use a little heat but was otherwise tasty, although a bit pricey at $19.

There's cheaper sushi around town, but cheaper doesn't always mean better. And not all sushi spots offer butterfish. So Red Sushi gets the green light from me!
The food here was good. Quick service and friendly staff. Perfect place for a quick bite to eat before hitting the tables.

Please read the reviews, I did not... Big mistake. Iv was craving sushi and the valet  guys said it was really good. The miso soup was better than everything else. I had the tempura shrimp roll and the eal cucumber roll. It was OK I've had better. The second roll I ordered after I finished the 1st one big mistake it took about 20 minutes to get it. Not sure who over looked the order but someone did. I'm not a sushi chef but I bet if I had the right tools I could roll it better than they did. It was falling apart. Save yourself money and time and hi somewhere else. If you want to drive to the Luxor they have great food and restaurants. Service was OK again nothing to write home about. Dad to say but oh well. The claim jumper restaurant was great.
Price point excellent! Fresh, Staff great. Golden Nugget is awesome, Our new Sushi place in Vegas.

Do Not Waste Your Money!!  Bad service.  Poor quality.  Rice was like mochi.  Asked if chef could make a scallop/mayo sushi.  Waitress came back and asked if I wanted bay or large scallops.  I asked if the chef can make it with mayo and waitress replied in the affirmative.  Sushi came and there was no mayo.  No one asked how the sushi was or if we needed anything.  Now I can see why there were only 3 other people there at 7 p.m.  A conveyer belt sushi place is better than this.

The decore of the place is really attractive however the food definitely not worth the price.  Talk about over priced food, the sushi was no better than that of a buffet restaurant.  Spent over $30 for 2 rolls, completely unsatisfied.  This place gets 1 star for good decore.

Nice Japanese food offerings in the Golden Nugget Hotel in downtown Vegas.  The happy hour specials are great.  

Chicken karaage, spicy edamame, avocado/salmon and shrimp tempura sushi rolls were nice plus we tried the sparkling sake drink which was a fun try.  Tastey offerings which we would  definitely try again.  

Total bill: $26 outstanding!

WORST sushi place!! Tried the soft shell crab roll and dynamite roll and it was absolutely disgusting!! I got food poisoning all day!
Would never recommend this place to anybody, and it really deserves zero stars!
I really liked this place.  Great sushi great service.  Was a  little pricey but was well worth it.

Horrible....Really a shame because Vegas is usually known for good dining.  

The spring rolls were soggy and the sushi wasn't fully cooked.  The wait staff hardly spoke engrish and we could not wait to get out of there.  Ugghhh.

I hope the Golden Nugget reads this and improves.  We love the hotel but not this...

4 small pieces of tuna sashimi: 16 dollars 
5 asparagus: 5 dollars

Small, casual restaurant located inside The Golden Nugget hotel. It is noisy because the casino is directly next to the tables. Highly overpriced in my opinion for food that is ok quality.
Throughly enjoyed my sushi experience. Food was fresh and everything I would expect from a sushi bar. Expensive, but my meal was worth it and it was a nice splurge while here in Vegas.
The food was good I ordered a bottle of wine but the server took forever to come back and place the order on our main entrees. Overall not satisfied with the service nor ambience.
Really disgusting sushi other than the nice service I would never ever come here poor quality sushi and way overpriced.
Just over hyped...expensive and sushi is just A-OK... We had to eat here during the dinner break of our tourney and it's just convenient as i was just outside the ballroom door of the GN.

Ended up eating here last night to join my hubby and his coworkers for dinner... Epic fail people! Having been to many sushi places, I have developed quite a critique for sushi places and this one is at the bottom of my list. Slow service, small servings that come with a hefty price, and their rolls were bland and lacked any type of kick! I'm just glad i didn't have to pay! Definitely not going back!

My friends and I stayed at the Golden Nugget for the great pool/shark tank. We didn't feel like going far to grab a bite to eat so we stopped at Red to get some sushi. All four of us were very disappointed in the sushi, especially for the price. We should have gone to a buffet. It was dry and pretty much blah. The service was friendly, but I definitely will choose to spend my money elsewhere in the future. With so many good dining choices in Vegas, don't waste one of them here.

My coworkers and I stopped in to get Sushi on our last night in Vegas after attending a work conference. Aaron, our bartender made our last night a fun one! He made some great reccomendations, took some great photos for us, and overall gave us a great experience! 
The sushi was good too, the pop rock roll sounded gross but was actually pretty good, and really fun... force yourself to try it!!

Sushi was good not the best.  The waitress was a little slow with taking order but was friendly.  There was a lot of flavour but not a lot of options, really really enjoyed the sea urchin sashimi was best  I have had rest of the sushi was average.

Located in the Golden Nugget near the casino and high foot traffic.  It can be a little noisy for some, but it's bearable.  It's a small restaurant with table and sushi bar seating. 

There's been a lot of negative reviews from people that apparently consider Golden Nugget a "upscale resort/hotel" and expect more from such a place......But people it's just the Golden Nugget.

Service was friendly and very prompt.  Our water glasses were never empty and the our waitress made sure we were taken care of.

Sushi quality is very good however the menu is limited.  We ordered the spicy tuna roll, vegetable roll and Godzilla roll.  The spicy tuna was the best I've had.  The tuna was very fresh, and the spice was perfect.  The vegetable roll is what one would expect.
The Godzilla roll is basically a spicy tuna roll with tempura flakes, avocado, spicy mayo and a little more.  Also equally as good as the spicy tuna roll.

This is a great tasting sushi joint for anyone staying on or near Fremont St.

Again, this place continues to amaze.  Denny Ono, Chef Jonathan, and Mashi entertained and created another fabulous dinner.  The tuna sashimi that I had last Sunday night was very tasty and the spicy tuna rolls were again delicious.  It's two-for-two for this hidden gem here at the Golden Nugget.  Thanks again for the great hospitality.  I'll be sure to come back soon.

Eh... Might have given it a 2 star but really unimpressive. Pulling bones out of my mouth from the Hamachi, Shells from the California role and sand from the Scallop Unagi. A warm $8.00 beer. It all would have been a 2.5 but for the lack of attention. Didn't complain until the server asked how the meal was and I pointed to the pile of debris on my plate... That seemed to be the end of it. Received and paid the FULL bill, even left a tip. First and last visit for me. Avoid. There are all you can eat sushi buffets that are 10 time better then this place let alone real mom and pop sushi bars.

Horrible food!!! Had the crab roll and dynamite lobster!  Smelled and was slimy!!! NOT fresh at all! We should have known since we were table number 2! Got food poisoning!!! The location was convenient but not worth it!  REVIEW ZERO STARS.

The sushi is located inside the golden nugget casino area. 
Service was quick, but it took a while to get refills 
The sushi looked great, but was not anything spectacular.
Since this place is inside a casino, the smell of the smoke was kind of in the taste of the sushi. There was an open atmosphere where the division was a small gate between the casino floor and the food. 
For a casino restaurant in Vegas, it was decently  and convenient.

This place is okay for happy hour and convenient in a pitch. 

Very over priced sushi ! Sashimi was disguised into making it look bigger in 2nd portion. The coke was flat  and flavorless.
$100 for dinner without any booze, beer or cocktails! 

Just come here for a quick happy hour and don't waste on a dinner - so many other places in Vegas!

Service was very slow.  Took us 20 minutes to get the 3 rolls we ordered.  We actually never saw our waitress after we placed our order....She never came to check on us.  The salad was yummy.  But that was it.  The udon was blan.  The rolls were not yummy and the ponzu tasted like taquilla.  The selection of food you could choose from was very poor and expensive for no reason. Overall poor experience. Would not recommend it.

Loved this place! Won some money at Golden nugget and ran into this sushi joint. Order a bunch of food paid about &40 not bad did two people. We were there during happy hour ordered spicy tuna, salmon avocado roll, dynamite, and shrimp tempura yummmmm

I was very disappointed with this spot. After finally deciding to stay in Old Vegas at the Golden Nugget, I didn't have much energy to leave the hotel to find food; with that said, we decided to eat within our hotel. This place was the first one we came across since its right out in front (sort of) of the Rush Tower. 

First, the price is NOT right, ridiculously overpriced for no reason. Taste isn't the best but isn't as bad as some spots I've been to. I am not a smoker so being around smoke while trying to enjoy the meal is NOT ideal. Although I may not look it, I am a BIG eater, lol, so small servings don't cut it for me.

Overall, I would not come back nor would I recommend but if you're rich and don't really know sushi, this is your spot. Otherwise, sorry to be a bubble popper. :[

I am a huge sushi enthusiast and I felt like this place was missing every good cut of fish I'd normally order. The prices are ridiculous for the amount of sushi you get. The sake selection is horrible and you sit in the middle of the slots. I was not impressed.

My wife and I came here for dinner on busy Sunday football night. Ironically, this place wasn't as busy when we first entered and sat at the bar. We had the following: 

Agedashi Dofu $6

Soft Shell Crab Roll (fried soft shell crab and daikon sprouts) $14

Red Tiger Roll (shrimp tempura roll topped with spicy tuna and avocado) $17

Kim Chee Fried Rice $10

Sea Urchin Hand Roll $15.95

So, where should I start. Well, the setting is nice, clean and err....very red in decor. The tofu dish was actually my favorite of all the dishes. It was not greasy and the soy dashi broth it came with was pretty yummy (Note: Now, you know something's wrong if the best tasting dish was a tofu dish!). The sushi rolls tasted ok but I could not taste much of the filling. The presentation was there but the flavors didn't pop at all. Oh ya, there were about 6-7 pieces per sushi roll and my wife and i were still hungry after eating $31 worth of sushi rolls. The Kim Chee Fried Rice didn't taste that good to me. It tasted like it was a day old at least. My wife got her sea urchin roll and she said it tasted good. Overall, this place is ok but there are WAY BETTER sushi restos in Vegas (i.e. Yama Sushi on Flamingo, Sushi Twister on Tropicana, etc..). And I mean better in taste and value.  Our bill came out to about $70 but I didn't it feel like it was worth it. I'm only giving this place 2 stars bc the staff are nice and attentive and they got tvs.
Sushi is pretty good, however it's way to over priced to be worth it,28 bucks for an order of Teryaki??

The reviews seem to be extremely up and down for Red Sushi. And it seems like service and price, more than the food itself, are the big sticking points with Red Sushi. I was only here for a quick bite of their happy hour specials, so the price points were fine for me. I ordered their Crispy Pork Belly Kushi and Spicy Tuna Roll, both at $6. That's a tad pricy for a spicy tuna roll, but it is an 8-piece roll rather than six. The spicy tuna roll was good, but could have used a touch more heat. The pork belly skewers were awesome. I'd definitely come back for these. 

Service was fine for me ... but I did just get there after opening and was the only person there when I sat down. Based on my experience, I give them 4 stars and I'd definitely try them again. But if the negative reviews are accurate, I wouldn't be surprised if I wound up updating my review after future visits.

It's all about the design. I'm in town for the week long fashion convention...2018's gonna bring you champagne colors and leaf prints...yep leaf prints.

Whoever designed Red Sushi got it right, I did the sake bomb it was $4 dollars. The vegetable rice bowl is a big bowl of healthiness!

Red Sushi's a great place for happy hour stop in and soak up the design.

Came in for the first time, the waiter was very nice and attentive to our needs. The food came out quick and was delicious. Will be back for sure.. very convenient since we stay at the golden nugget very often. Just a walk downstairs.. loved it , thank you
Pretty cool sushi just slightly expensive.

I ordered the rainbow roll and was very disappointed..It had some sort of mush inside the roll(looked like tuna from a can), and the different fish on top didn't taste or look fresh.  The actual restaurant itself was very nicely decorated and had a friendly staff.  However, I came for the sushi not for anything else.. big disappointment, especially for the price point. (around $18 for one order-around 6 to 8 peices).  The other people in my party thought their orders were mediocre.

I'm not sure if everyone else on here that gave it 5 stars might quite possibly have been drunk (it is vegas)...which I know when I'm a lil tipsy, everything tastes yummy..lol

Service was extremely awkward here. Food was just fine. We were directed to choose a table by one man behind the sushi bar, then, chastised by the hostess for seating ourselves.  They one brought 3 waters for 4 people. They did not bring us a pot to refill our own hot teat, you had to ask for refills (odd). They kept bringing us saki glasses for some reason. Just weird.

Anyway, the food was pretty good. No complaints and came out reasonably quick. The sushi had no smell indicating it was fresh. Gyoza had great flavor in the filling. The veggie roll contained a baby carrot and I now know why sushi typically uses carrot sticks. I implore Red to also try using the carrot sticks! Makes for a better textured bite of the roll. 

Bill for 4 or 5 rolls, gyoza, saki, and hot tea was $87. I think we got more bang for our buck out in LA, but hey, it is resort dining. If you're downtown, this is a way better option than Nathans or Magnolias, but not the best around Vegas or anywhere.

I remember my wife and I tried this place before and didn't like it, but we were lured in by the reasonable happy hour menu and decided to try it again. Wish we didn't! We sat down and we were barely acknowledged by the sushi cook. We ordered everything on the happy hour menu, Spicy Tuna, Tempura, Salmon rolls, Garlic Green Beans, and Sake Bombs. I handed the sushi order to the chef and he mumbled I was to give it to the waitress, ok whatever.
Sake Bomb was ok, nothing I would order again.
Spicy Tuna Roll was not spicy.
Tempura Roll, the shrimp tasted like it was cooked yesterday.
Salmon Roll, just so-so.
All the rolls had gummy rice. 
The Green Beans had great flavor, but the beans were so soft from being over cooked, I wont recommend.
Try anywhere else, I get the impression nobody care how the food taste to the customers here.
Bad service, mediocre food, outrageous price.  If you have to ask the manager to speak to the manager, he's not doing his job right.  $1.50 Togo order charge = canceling my $6 tip.

Decent sushi place for the price. We went for happy hour, so we had $5 salmon and avocado rolls and $6 spicy tuna rolls. The sushi was just okay but nothing special. The restaurant is on the casino floor so pick somewhere else if you want someplace quiet or intimate or have a large group.

I really wanted to like Red Sushi, because it's only 0.5 miles from my condo. Sadly what I found was a sushi restaurant in Fremont that charges Strip prices. $14 for a California roll? C'mon. They also only have 24 rolls to choose from, pretty anemic compared to most sushi places.

With that said, the sushi was good and the rolls were large. We had the Godzilla Roll and the Firecracker roll. The Firecracker Roll is heated in an oven but not spicy, so perhaps that's where it gets its name. We also had the fried rice, which was probably the best part of the meal. 

Bottom line, the food is good but the prices and selection are both not ideal for me.

I just went to this place I was really craving some Vegas Rolls. So I went with my boyfriend and my daughter. He ordered his food I ordered mine and my daughters I had to repeat myself a couple times. My boyfriend got his food first about 5 mins after my daughter got her food. The lady came to check up on us I asked for my food and she said she didn't hear me order it but yet I repeated my order twice. BAD SERVICE.

Sorta hidden in the corner of slot machines, this place was yummers. A bit pricey, but they handled our drunk asses at Midnight on a Sunday and did so with a smile. Their Philly Rolls, and tuna sashimi were jammin' and unpretentious. I like that you are in the casino, but kinda out of it and its really good. It's also cool that you can saunter in after a bad luck streak and get your soosh on.
Not great sushi but nice staff and it is pretty. Happy hour is decent. Chicken app is yummy, rolls pretty average, if that. Garlic edamame was yummy too.

If you're hankerin' for sushi in this area of town, this is a fine choice. The fish was fresh and the rolls were expertly made. But very expensive. Not by Vegas sushi standards, perhaps, but for real, way more than I wanted to spend. 

My suggestion if you want sushi in Vegas? Go to the Bellagio buffet (or likely any one of the other upscale hotel buffets) and go crazy.

Stop by here on the way to I don't know where nice Little Vegas spot old town. Dave was our bartender/waiter we sat at the actual bar not the sushi bar. Good conversation with the local. We ordered the firecracker roll a little spicy but very good. The only downfall no calamari, But they did have fried rice. The hand roll  was excellent also price was pretty decent too. It's located inside the Golden Nugget.

Yum, order the dynamite roll and it was amazing, we also ordered the red tiger roll would definitely recommend this place!! Jennifer was our bartender / server she was extremely nice and knowledgeable about the menu and drinks. She kept us entertained was fast about taking our orders and making sure we enjoyed everything!!! We will defiantly be returning!!!!
No duh it's expensive it's in the middle of the Golden Nugget Casino. I have eatin a lot of Sushi shared a quick tuna roll and salmon roll. It was so fresh melted in my mouth like butter
I agree with the reviews, between a 2 and 3. Decent sushi, overpriced but good service.

Great sushi, we had a misu soup and caterpillar and salmon sashimi.
It was beyond our expectations at this place.
Definitely try it out whenever you get a chance.
You won't get dissatisfied.
The sushi was just ok.  We had a couple basic rolls and  a couple "specialty rolls"  They were not that special.  Service was also not so good.
Horrible sushi and they gave us the worst quail shooters ever!!! We even got sick afterwards. Gas station sushi would have been better. I do not recommend this place!!!

Red Sushi is located inside The Golden Nugget Casino in Downtown Las Vegas on Fremont Street. We had not been to Downtown in years and decided to visit there and have some sushi if the opportunity presented itself. We parked at the Golden Nugget and saw this restaurant on our way outside to Fremont street. We also caught the Happy Hour where pricing was great for sushi rolls however the items on that menu were very limited. Given the happy hour pricing and some decent choices we were good to go. The decor was very nice and modern. The restaurant was predominantly red in color to match its name. The seating arrangement was a little too tight for us. If you do not get a seat at the sushi bar or on a table then you will be seated at a long bench type seating where other diners may be seated quite close to you. Close enough that one would have to strike a conversation. 
We had the Salmon Avocado Roll, The Tuna Roll and Garlic Chicken. I normally prefer Sashimi however none of that was on the happy hour menu. The happy hour portions are matched to the pricing and therefore do not expect a hearty sushi roll. You get just the basics. Sushi and the chicken tasted good however not as fresh as I expected. I have had seafood/sushi/sashimi in Vegas where the fish tasted fresh but not quite so at Red Sushi and Hibachi Grill. Maybe because it was the Happy Hour Menu. Not sure. In the end the experience was not bad but also not memorable. I will probably forget about it once I hit "POST" on this review.

First time ate here was last year with my sister, niece + her boyfriend. Loved it. This year had to take my husband .. Was even better. Yes Location is in a high traffic area (weekends) but during the weekdays, its not too bad. I would rather sit at the bar then the tables. Food, great, we ordered California & Alaskan Sushi. Shared the Wongton soup. Perfect for the both of us.

If you're on Freemont Street and want Sushi- this is the place! 

Right in the middle of the Golden Nugget Hotel and Casino is the little gem. Their sushi is excellent and considering you're in Vegas, extremely well priced! 

Service is always excellent, and this is a fantastic spot for people watching! 

I highly recommend Red Sushi!

I don't know how this place only has an average of 2.5 stars!  Every time I've eaten here it's been great, to my surprise being that Fremont isn't well known for it's restaurants (at least not that side of Fremont.) Although Red Sushi is within a casino, the prices aren't nearly as expensive as anywhere on the strip and the quality and service has always been very good. The lucky roll is one of my favorites.  Definitely an underrated gem :)

I was totally impressed with the Red Sushi!  The staff was so much fun.  I sat at the sushi bar and the sushi chefs interacted with you immediately.  I had a soft shell crab hand roll and scallop sashimi.  Both met my expectations.  I would love to return again to try some other rolls and sashimi.  Happy hour pricing was a great deal and, if you want to "try this place", is a great way to try it without spending a large amount of monies.

First of all,  my wife and I love the Golden Nugget.  Fremont is way better than the strip.  But if your gonna eat sushi, don't eat it at Red.  Yes, of course it is way over priced, but, this is Vegas; so get over it.  The problem is, the rice in the rolls tastes like dirty dish water and all of the ingredients blend together with no distinct taste whatsoever.  We had two rolls at about 12 to 16 dollars apiece, which is a little pricey, but the kicker is that each roll only had 5 to 6 pieces; not the normal 7 to 8 pieces that we have experienced all over the country.  So, you are getting 2/3 the food for about twice the price.  Wouldn't be too bad in Vegas if it didn't taste like butt.

After I finished eating my Happy Hour meal, I was SERIOUSLY sick to my stomach.  I remained ill for the rest of my vacation in Las Vegas.  I have NEVER gotten this ill from sushi.  Clearly, I had been infected with a parasite.

To make matter worse, I left a cash tip (for which the waitress was very happy), but they still charged me for a tip on my card.  I figured this out after I verified the charge. Not only did I get sick, but I was cheated as well.

If I could give this place 0 stars, I would.

Maybe because in San Diego I am spoiled by all the top notch ramen spots or maybe because I've been eating food for almost 40 years but their ramen at this place is trash. Cold tasteless broth, salty eggs and undercooked noodles. If this spot was in San Diego it wouldn't last a week. Shameful. You would more enjoyment out of a cup o noodle.

Terrible sushi.. Terrible service.. 
Sat down never got our menus till we asked for it..like hello?! We came to eat not sit down..our lady server Yuki only acknowledge us when we ordered..me and my sister ordered red tiger roll and caterpillar roll and uni nigiri
..also ordered a edamame and a miso soup and rice for my nephew. Got our miso soup and rice first then our rolls.. The rice in the rolls was lacking the vinager so it tasted like plain rice ..the quality of fish wasn't bad..the caterpillar roll tasted like a DIRTY RAG..eel sauce was watery which is suppose to be thick..yuck! There was also another lady server who didn't make any eye contact because she didn't want to help us..just kept running off saying no no no..we never recieved our edamame which was suppose to be the first thing we get so we asked to cancel it and she was saying that they had it !!dafuq!! but we were already done eating !! Why would you bring such a simple and small appetizer at the end of the meal?! Yuki wasn't even sorry for such slow service..like she didn't care and hated her job! the only person that helped us was Melvin ..I think he was the busser. NEVER EVER AGAIN! Wish I could rate this place a big fat 0

My husband and I enjoyed a nice meal at the sushi bar here before cabbing over to see Penn & Teller at the Rio.  The ambience is very informal but they prepare their food with care.  I don't eat sushi but I love tempura and that is what I ordered.  

The shrimp & vegetable tempura was prepared well and was very tasty!  My husband enjoyed several selections from their extensive menu and enjoyed them all!  Some of his favorites were: the spicy tuna hand roll and the dynamite and Vegas roll.  Several of the sashimi were very good, too, including the Maguro and Hamachi. 

It's a very small establishment so there may be a wait but it's worth it.

This is a very nice side restaurant in the Golden Nugget. It was slightly awkward as we stood at the entrance for while as servers walked right past us so I decided to just grab the last table available and call someone over instead of continuing to stand there like an idiot. However, once someone decided to help us, the service was good and the food was tasty as well. I ordered the avocado/cream cheese/salmon roll. It was an 8/10...the cream cheese was a little much but over all worth it, although slightly over priced. Bottom line, if you're in the area its a good idea but I wouldn't make a special drive over there just for it.

Just roaming out of the Golden Nugget, we were pretty much starving, had to get a bite to eat and my husband craved sushi over the last day or 2 and there it was....RED Sushi.

We are typically scared of most sushi places that we don't know of or have recommendations for (even those we get recommendations for), we sat at the bar and noticed the time and the happy hour menu.  SCORE!

We ordered a couple of miso soups and the garlic edamame and it was so super yummy.  We also got 2 rolls and they were both very, VERY good!
My husband had a beer and I think I just stuck with water...

Just couldn't beat what we got for around $30.  Our cheapest sushi bill EVER!

It was conveniently located and good service.
The service and food is outstanding. It is a must try if you want fresh, DELICIOUS sushi! Thank you to the amazing chefs and wait staff...perfect every time!
Not bad. Had spicy tuna and udon soup...and shared gyoza with the table.

This sushi place was great, I dont think I have eaten inside a open restaurant in a casino. our table was right next to a walkway. I could literally high five everyone walking by, or they could have taken a shrimp tempura off my plate and ran with it. Very different. Our food was pretty good, I got my usual, anything with soft shell crab (deep fried of course) and my husband also got a roll I believe it was the california roll? It was a pretty expensive restaurant though. I did however like their miso soup, but I like all miso soup. The waiters were very sweet they took care of us, especially my drunk-ness I was starving & they brought out complimentary steamed edamame because they probably could tell I was a little drunk. But it was a nice experience overall.
Over priced but it's the only sushi spot in downtown but the food was above average and fulfilled my craving.

UN-FRICKEN-BELIEVABLE!!!!!

Can I please get a ZERO stars option? Please?

I am certain if you look back at all my reviews you will read somewhere where I boasted:

     "There is no such thing as bad sushi!" 

     Well, guess what? -- we have found BAD sushi! 

Red Sushi Hibachi Grill has, was I would gently refer to, as the the "Worst Sushi on Planet Earth!"

    No - "WORST SUSHI IN THE GALAXY!!"

These people do not even pretend they are not terrible. The discerning look of utter disinterest on the face of my sushi chef, as he watched me scrape the layer of wasabi paste from the bottom of my fish and picked away at the mountain still on top of my rice, spoke volumes about this joke of a sushi bar. I was nearly floored by how he caked on the wasabi like a bricklayer building a wall.

Of course it wasn't until I finished, with my 10 minute chore of scraping the wasabi from my fish, that I realized I should have kept it on. The Fish Was Nasty!  

Let me say that again:

     THE FISH WAS "DRAGGED THROUGH THE CRACK OF SOME DISHWASHER'S ARSE" NASTY! 

I was starting to wish I ate just the wasabi.

I am so flabbergasted by the pure crap of this disgusting tourist trap, that I literally had a coronary when the bill arrived. At the bequest of my doctor, I am not supposed to go into detail about the bill - he fears it may kill me to talk about it again. 

     Uuuhh, my chest!

   If you want to know what sushi DOES NOT taste like? - go to Red.
   If you want to experience the "worst of the Worst"? - go to Red.
   If you want to imagine Nobu Matsuhisa going Kamikaze on some place? - go to Red.
   If you want Dishwasher Arse dragged over your tongue? go to Red.
   If you want to know what it is like to hit Absolute Bottom? - go to Red.
   If you are the absolute dumbest person on the planet? - don't go to red (I was being facetious before).
   If you want to have your stomach pumped by a fat, bald intern with BO? - go to Red,

Will somebody please do the world a favor, and invite Bruce Banner to have sushi at Red? -- Please? -- Someone? -- Please? -- Anyone?  --  For the love of Mike!

P.S. If anyone is particularly good at Memory Charms, I am willing to pay.

Met up with some friends for sushi last Sat night, they picked this place because it was close to the club they were heading too.

Our sever was Nori, she was amazing, very helpful and friendly.  One of my friends ordered a round of Sake for us, the Sake was warm with a powerful kick! My friend also wanted to do a Sake Bomb , but Red Sushi does not serve them, but if you know how set one up, you will find they have everything you need, so some did some Sake Bombs too.

Now I don't know if this is normal or not, but a friend and I showed up a little late to dinner and we still had in our hand our solo cup of booze, and never once did they tell us we had to get rid of it, maybe it because we were buying booze too. Who knows, but hey its Vegas baby!

Now is this the best sushi I have had? No, but is this the worst sushi I have had, no way. To start with I ordered some edamame; it was perfectly steamed and salted.  Then I ordered some California rolls, and you have the choice of having it either as a hand roll (looks like a sushi ice cream cone) or rolls, I went with rolls , it was fresh and it was good, I also ordered a Poppin Rock Sushi Roll, it was spicy tuna, crabmeat & avocado, never for the life of me did I think it would have pink pop rocks on top of it, but damnit it did. It was a shock me too, I guess I should have figured it out with the name Poppin Rock right? But after I got over the oh wow part, it was tasty, the mix of the flavors worked. 

And for everything I ordered it ran me 28 bucks, now I had read the reviews and everyone said it was crazy expensive, but 28 sounds about right for me, everything I ordered tasted good and was fresh.  Would I come back again, sure why not?  Would I go for the Poppin Rock again, well probably not haha.
We stopped in this place during our trip to vegas, it was delish!! especially the soft shell crab roll!! out of this world! a little pricey but it was worth it.

I was hoping for a better sushi dinner than what I had. When my spicy tuna came out it was falling apart and the fish was warm. That tells me that they are leaving the fish out on the counter. The overall experience at this place was not good at all.
Very very very overpriced holy crap!!! 5 little pieces of sushi was $18 bucks!! It was good food but give me more..... Fried tempura was great. Service was super friendly. Just expensive.
Sushi lacked so much flavor and I think the actual fish was bad . Didn't get food poisoning that's a good thing ?
Stick with the rolls and ramen soup. We loved the Poppin rockin sushi roll. And we tried the ramen soup. Came back 2 nights in a row. Service is so so but other than that, we loved the place!

Ordered spicy tuna roll to take back to the room. It was delicious. Not knock your socks off (it is just a spicy tuna roll..I was not feeling adventurous) but it was rolled perfectly.  It was really quick too. Will definitely go back.

I haven't been in the Golden Nugget in quite a while. Took my wife and Friends to Red Sushi for the first time. I have to say that I was very impressed. It has a nice sheek look and located in an area that gives you a nice view of the Casino.
The Sushi was fresh and very tasty. We also had an assortment of rolls, crab, salad, and cocktails.  The food came out very prompt and the service was very good.
The Executive Chef checked on us a few times and he was very cordial and suggested some other items to try.
This is defiantly going to be my new hang out spot downtown.
Easy to get to and easy to park.

Red Sushi has a wonderful happy hour!  Awesome that happy hour is on Saturdays and Sundays too, not just weekdays.

I ordered every sushi roll offered on the happy hour menu, the garlic chicken and edamame.
Vegas is pricy, but the Red Sushi happy hour menu is super affordable. I've been here at least 4 times this past year and always have had a great experience. I've never ordered from the regular menu, this review is strictly for the happy hour.  Tasty food, great service. Happy hour makes me happy!
Just average. Service was average. Food was mediocre. Don't have to go again and I wouldn't recommend it. We sat at the bar and the chefs didn't interact with us at all.

I'm currently staying at the golden nugget and didn't want to wander far to find something delightful to eat. So, I figured I would go downstairs and satisfy my craving for some rice. Typical Asian, yeah I know. 

I arrive at Red sushi and my eyes were set on the house fried rice and garlic chicken karrage (sp?). Both happened to be satisfactory to my taste to say the least. 

What really made me give this place 2 stars was that I had horrible service. As a party of one, I was standing at the entrance for a few minutes as the hosts/servers were just standing around mingling with each other. By all means I understand if you're interacting with other guests then I don't mind waiting but that wasn't the case. The only time the servers asked me during my meal if everything was okay or if i needed anything was when I was a couple bites away from finishing my meal. I feel like just because everyone else was in a party of two or more I shouldn't be treated any less. I have worked for tips for a living before and usually a decent tipper. 

To be honest I would have probably received better treatment at McDonald's. Which is pretty sad in my opinion. Oh well, it's safe to say I won't be eating here again or referring this place to anyone I know.

The chef's were lethargic, and there was no way to communicate with them, let alone the overworked waitress.  Combined with the triple digit food prices, and low quality made this meal horrible.    Didn't even wait for the shrimp heads to arrive......
Overpriced and out of almost everything I ordered. Why didn't I just leave? Oh that is right, I was too lazy to leave Fremont. Face. Palm.

It would be hard to compare this to other sushi places in town, it would be totally unjust.  So me and two buddies came here instead of Golden Gate to give it a try.  We should have stuck to our guns and gone with our first decision to eat somewhere else.  My experience here wasn't a complete downer.  I marked it down to two stars because I was dissapointed with the sushi.  

For appetizers we ordered the seared tuna and shrimp tempuras.  The seared tuna was good but the sesame miso dressing was too much, go easy on it.  Nothing was wrong with the shrimp or veggie tempura.  Okay now on to the heartbreak of this review: the sushi.  Your sushi order comes with two pieces and they average around $7 - $9.  Totally out of line.  You can get it sashimi style (which is good!) but then the price bumps up to almost $5 on top of it.  

We skipped on the entree dishes but I've had their chicken teriyaki before.  You definitely want the teriyaki sauces on any of the dishes on the side.  We didn't have any sake bombs or any alcoholic drinks but we did have their chocolate Mt Fuji dessert which was good.  

Definietly not worth the price, but hey.. they have toro!!
Service is slow and the sushi is not that great. I've been a few times now and haven't liked it much. There are much better places to go in the area. I doubt we will go here again

My friend and I stopped by here for their happy hour during our last visit in Vegas. We got 1 spicy salmon roll, 1 spicy tuna roll, 1 fried rice, and 2 chicken appetizers. That was more than enough food for us! The rolls were decent.. pretty small, but what do you expect for happy hour! The fried rice was actually pretty good and went perfectly with the chicken. The chicken appetizer itself was also really good! Not the best sushi around, but it was actually pretty decent!

If you have a chance to stop by this great restaurant, please do so. The ingredients are on display to show you the freshness. Service is cordial from Asian employees. They are very knowledgeable and they are very helpful. This sushi chef is highly entertaining and makes everything seem desirable. The roles that they prepare are highly crafted and remarkable. They taste amazing and they have a palatable spark with their ingredients.

Any self respecting sushi eater should avoid this place. We were staying at the Golden Nugget and decided to get a couple of rolls before hitting the strip and we were thoroughly disappointed. Sushi is fish, but it should never taste fishy and both rolls we were served were not fresh and tasted awful. The service was slow and the experience was an all around fail. Do yourself a favor and check out the buffet upstairs.

Food was great, service was slow. 
Just like J said we arrived just in time for Happy Hour lol 
We had the garlic edamame which is always good.  Anything that has garlic on it...I'm going to order.  
I also ordered the Pork Belly which did remind me of a chicharron.  No, que no?
Also had some rolls that were yummy too.

Red Sushi was always a late night snack for me.  Just a little something after the music died down on Fremont st.  It was very good.  But the last time I was there they offered me miso soup which I accepted.  $6 really?!! It was good. It wasn't that good.

This place is 3 stars at best.  Located in such an upscale hotel, I thought this place would blow my mind with amazing tastes.  What such a disappointment.  We ordered ramen and something simple, a California roll.  It's hard to mess up a California roll.  The roll was bland and needed seasoning.  The rice and the seaweed were so plain.  The soy sauce helped it a little bit, but the filling was bland too.

The ramen was okay.  The noodles were dense and the broth definitely needed some sort of flavoring.  Look somewhere else if you're wanting to eat quality sushi.
Yummy and happy hour was good to the Dragon roll the peach saki drink and the rest we tried was so yummy

Amazing sushi! We sat at the bar so we could watch them make all the yummy rolls. The chef working in our section was funny and really entertaining. A little spendy, but it's Vegas. Would definitely recommend the pop rock roll!

This is my 2nd time within a week and both times were brief yet perfect. Because of it's location within the Nugget it's easily accessible and the sushi chefs are really fast. Old as the hills, but fast as hell.  The portions were nice, the service efficient and the price wasn't too ridiculous. a great way/place to get yo' grub on in short order.

I was surprised to see that the reviews on here were so low. We didn't look at the reviews we decided to go there for happy hour btw 4-6. We got a sushi roll & the salmon roll with the garlic edamame. I also ordered the salmon orange salad off the regular menu. 

Really absolutely no complaints the place is located right near the rush tower, we would definitely go again.

I usually don't hand down too many 1 or 2 star reviews, but Red Sushi needs some work.  Located inside the Golden Nugget Hotel, it presents itself as an upscale sushi restaurant.  Truth be told, the food quality is on par with a food court.

The shrimp tempura udon was plain. Soup base was too salty. Shrimp and veggies were over battered.

Also ordered the California roll and that too was lack luster.

It's a little surprising that the hotel lets Red Sushi continue on it's 2-star path.  It needs a change in course.
This place is beyond bad, service and sushi. I will not go back. I feel like supermarkets with sushi might taste better. Big disappointment.

When you arrive, the place is very bright and cheerful looking; however we were not sure if we should seat ourselves or wait on someone. We saw some seats open and a server immediately came over and brought menus. I am glad the place was not very busy yet, as seating is limited and it is "family style". 

I went to Red Sushi on a Saturday and was surprised they actually offer Happy Hour on the weekend. My friend ordered off the Happy Hour menu, but I decided to play it safe with a Vegetable Roll. I am vegetarian, so I was appreciative they do offer meatless options. The roll was fresh, rolled well (I hate it when rolls fall apart as soon as you add soy sauce and ginger). Our server brought the food out very quickly and was friendly enough. 

The only reason I did not give more stars is I did not care for the seating and on a busy afternoon/evening, your back is facing the casino and there was a lot going on behind me. Other than that, I would definitely go back and just choose a different seat.
Great food, great HH deal. Thanks for our server YURI, attentive service and we had a good time there tonight. Will be back!!
We eat here every time we come to Vegas. The Sushi is very good, but the Sake list could use some work. Employees are great.

Way over priced.  The roll I got was not even complete.  The rice was not rolled all the way around.  It had a gap at the bottom where everything could just fall out.  I expected a lot more for the $ that the food costs here.  I would have thought the quality and preperation of this Sushi Resturant would have been a lot better in a four star Hotel and Casino like the Golden Nugget.

Downtown sushi at casino prices...thank goodness my friend had a groupon!

We had a $50 off groupon (not sure what she paid but that didn't apply to me-yay!) so we trekked to the Golden Nugget to eat right around 4 PM when Red Sushi opens to beat the crowd.  We sat at the bar.  The ambiance is nice but it is quite loud within the slots area.  Our sushi chef had on his name tag that he is from Japan, so I asked him where in Japan.  I could not hear his answer.  The set up sinks in the seats enough where our short chef seemed so far away and there is no way to converse...not my kind of set up.  We had 2 or 3 waitresses and they were all very kind - checked on us a lot and gave us refills regularly.  I had iced green tea.

We ordered mackerel, salmon, and sweet shrimp nigiri but our chef gave us hamachi instead of salmon originally.  We got to keep both :)  The sweet shrimp came out as sushi first and then we got the fried heads later!  Yummmmmy!  We also got some appetizers: seared scallops with ikura, spinach, and sesame miso sauce (sauce was blah), spicy tuna-avocado-rice stack with nori shreds, and hot oil seared hamachi sashimi with ginger and green onion.  The hot oil hamachi was the best thing we had.

We also each ordered a handroll - yellowtail for me and salmon avocado for Susan.  They were quite tiny but at least fresh.  Overall, it was average and overpriced, but with the $50 groupon it cost just over $35 before tip.  Splitting that and adding tip on the whole check is just under the cost of AYCE at Blue Fin.  I am glad I tried somewhere new but will return to my humble local joint next!
Over priced. Service not so great. Didn't inform us they were out of uni and toro before ordering many dishes and appetizers.... On the other hand, the sushi chef was very cool and very pleasant.

I would go ahead and pass this one by!   The rolls and overall food experience was marginal at best.  Food was slow to arrive and wrong temperature.    Even with the Happy Hour prices, its just not worth your time.   The service is also horrific.  The only folks attended to in the place seem to know the waitress, everyone else was treated like crap.
Food was awesome and the best edamame we've ever had.  The happy hour is the best deal ever.  I don't see how any of the reviews can be bad... this place was great!!!

Ate here tonight. In for the weekend from colorado. By far the most fresh sushi we've ever had. Egg rolls amazing. The sushi chef even rolled us our own "custom" hamachi roll. Loved it! My son ate here both nights of our stay. Pricy, but I don't trust "cheap" fish!
The service was lacking. Soups Ramen ect were terrible.  Don't waste time on the sushi it was crazy expensive and not good.

All food was either absolutely disgusting or very good. Whatever you do - do not order the pork app on the happy hour menu and the Octopus sashimi. Both were literally inedible. Luckily we got the octopus taken off though which was good. The shrimp tempura and spicy tuna/crab sushi rolls were both very good. As was the chicken app on the happy hour menu. Service was good and prices weren't bad.

This place was the best! Brian was our chef. He was very knowledgeable and offered great advice on different types of nigiri we would like. Very happy that we tried this place. Definitely doing it again when I'm back in town.

There's nothing spectacular about Red Sushi at the Golden Nugget.

You know those small take-out sushi joints that you find on the ground floor of office buildings, or those plodding sushi counters that frequent mall food courts? That's pretty much what you have here.

The specialty rolls were not all that special, and cost $15 on average. 

The only one that really stood out was the Firecracker Roll, which included breaded, deep-fried salmon bites, some cream cheese and jalapeno, and slivers of snow crab as a topping. The Vegas Roll, which one would hope would offer up some excitement -- Vegas Sushi, Baby! -- was simply cream cheese, avocado and cucumber, all rolled up, lightly fried, and topped with spicy tuna. Not very exciting. 

That said, Red Sushi does have a decent selection of hot and cold appetizers, which might make for a nice late-night snack while in the Downtown area, though not too-late-night, as they close at 11 pm. I particularly liked their ahi poke on lotus chips, the flash-fried hamachi served with a citrusy ponzu sauce, the agedashi dofu (deep fried tofu served in a delicate tentsuyu broth), and the crispy rock shrimp.

Red Sushi is also open to the casino floor and the Golden Nugget's ballroom, so if you happen to be sitting on its outer perimeter, you're also subject to a lot of smoke, noise, and drunken conventioneers.

I can't believe I just put this into my body.  It looked bad, smelled bad and tasted worse.  The tuna inside tasted like the tuna from those tuna and cracker snacks you get at seven eleven and you wonder how it is possible that it can be fresh... well it's not...  actually this isn't a fair comparison... to seven eleven that is.   Yes I've had better sushi at seven eleven.  and...  this cost me $60 for two diminutive rolls and a tiny hot saki.

Maybe if you are from Ohio and you've never had sushi before you might like this, but if you live anywhere near a cost with fresh fish DO NOT EAT HERE!!!

We were very disappointed..... yeah yeah yeah... I know... hotel sushi. But every other meal we had at the Golden Nugget was EXCELLENT!  The sushi here was unimaginative, very poorly wrapped and basically..: meh.  The pork belly appetizer was pretty good which is what raised my rating to a 2.  Skip this place as there are many better places to dine downtown.

I ordered a california roll and couldnt believe my eyes. I have never seen tan crab meat but i figured it was probably mixed with something so i ate it....it tasted like tuna fish out of the can (not albacore). I asked the sushi chef if i ordered a tuna fish roll and he said no we use real crab meat and showed me a big bowl of tan crab. Needless to say i sent it back and left.

My friends and I went here and were excited to see we could order off the happy hour menu. The regular menu was kind of pricy. We ordered pretty much everything off the happy hour menu (drinks included). I give this place five stars because they have the best edamame I've ever had! The spices and flavors they put on top were awesome and I've never had anything else like it! If you go there that is the must have menu item for me. The service was great. All of our food was brought out very quickly and our bill was brought out fast for us as well. Again the edamame is the best!!

My brother and I stopped in about 9:30 on Sunday night. There were a few other people dining here, but not many. We had our pick of where to sit. The waitress seated us, gave us the menus, and took our drink orders. We perused the menu for about 10 minutes and noticed that it's really varied. They seem to have a good selection.
We decided to try the Vegas Roll, the Alaskan Roll, and the Shrimp tempura. 
There is really no need to go into detail and describe each of these dishes because they were all done both masterfully and perfectly. 
My only regret is that we waited until our last night in Vegas to eat here because we would have eaten here every night if we'd known how good it was.

I ate here by myself as a business traveler. It was great for that. There aren't many tables...mostly bar and sushi bar seating. Joe, a newish bartender was my server. He engaged me just enough to keep me happy but he wasn't intrusive. I enjoyed the Vegas Roll, the Red Zen Tini (yum!) and the Mt. Fuji chocolate mousse dessert. Altogether, the bill was about $40+. The food was enjoyable, but as is with a sushi joint, the bill was high for not much food. Good thing I only wanted one cocktail and small portions. Overall, I recommend this restaurant if you are staying at the Golden Nugget or nearby in downtown, but don't go out of your way to visit.

Happy Hour specials from 4-6pm.  Pork Belly is fantastic 4pcs for $6,  sake bombs for $2 and sushi rolls vary from $6 to $8 the salmon/ avocado was by far my favorite. Service was fast and friendly.  Would definitely be back again!

Unimpressed............my husband and I are sushi freaks! Every trip we go on, we have to find a sushi place! We should have paid attention to the reviews! Some of them were good and we like to give them the benefit of the doubt sometimes! 

There was four of us who decided to go down to Freemont Street! After walking around aimlessly, we ended up settling for this place. Sashimi pieces did not seem fresh. Rice was dry and service took forever! It was kind of late in the evening and not many tables occupied. We knew it was probably close to closing time, but really? My girlfriend had the chicken teriyaki that was super dried out and nothing much for the sides. My husband hates to complain so I kept my mouth shut on this one. We just won't ever go back! I didn't even take pictures! I should have! It might go along with my description of everything! Tables were also dirty even after the waitress wiped it down with a "dirty" wet towel! This place gives the Japanese a bad name. :(

There are too many great restaurants in Vegas to settle for this one. Not worth the money at all and over priced at that! UGH!
Best sushi rolls I've ever had. Tempura shrimp with spicy tuna and avocado on top. Delicious!!!

Located inside the Golden Nugget Hotel, this is one of the few sushi places in Downtown LV. I found the sushi to be mediocre. Also the restaurant is oddly very open and slot machines are just paces away. I enjoyed the cocktails though, my "Red Zen Tini" was delicious.

Okay, I may be extremely picky and biased when it comes to Sushi.   Living in SoCal has many advantages and one of those advantages is access to phenomenal sushi.

Red Sushi fills a void in the downtown area, but it's just okay.  In my opinion the sushi rice was a tad bit off and the fish quality isn't on par with SoCal and other places in Vegas.   Service was okay, nothing special.  Price for quality is too high, but they probably have a higher rent than other places.

But if you're hanging out at the Golden Nugget and don't want to drive, this place works.

This was absolutely horrible! ! Make sure you ALWAYS look at the reviews before you eat some where! They don't care either! I guess because they get so many people who don't know they're horrible until it's to late they're not interested in repeat business. We had the yellow tail, salmon, edamame to start and before the rest of our food came out we canceled the order and left to go grab something at Grottos.

My friends wanted to do a quick snack, so we stopped in here. Considering I'm allergic to seafood, I only had their soy beans and garlic chicken. Both had great flavor, and the soy beans were one of my favorite preparations... instead of boring ol' steamed ones. The staff was friendly, attentive and we were in and out quickly.

The sushi rice was overdone. The yellowtail was fishy. The scallops were rubbery. Our waitress, Betty, had the worst attitude since we sat down. She rolled her eyes was super short. And didn't want to answer questions we had about the menu. The experience was awful.

Had dinner with my son here and the service was ok. the Sushi was good. they had one roll that was way to hot!! LOL   we better stick with the non hot rolls. if you are looking for hot rolls than this place would be for you. 

There is a long wait most of the time.

not for me!!

sushi was overpriced and not really fresh.  service was slow and not personable. 

 for similar prices, i rather have sushi at mirage, mgm and many other hotel sushi rests...
Overpriced ($9 for yellowtail) and quality below average.  This is my second bad food experience at the Golden Nuget.  Going back to the Wynn.

Only place in old Vegas that looked like it had decent sushi.  We ordered 5 different rolls and all were edible but not fantastic.  However, it satisfied the sushi craving for my wife so it was a good choice - except for the prices...which are WAY out of line with the environment (Fremont St. is supposed to be the affordable and low-key Vegas!).

Sushi was just OK. We found this place by accident because we were on a tight schedule and craved sushi. Sushi chefs were friendly & pretty attentive since we sat at the sushi bar, but it's on the pricey side. But of course, you GET what you pay for, so I will pay for good sushi! :) its just OK here. Service was sort of slow.

I would try this place again.

I make it a point to stop in at least once when I am in Las Vegas . . . since we frequent the Golden Nugget.  And up until this visit . . . I would say a solid four star establishment . . . this time . . . I was so disappointed that I only stopped in once.

The sushi . . . thought presented well . . . seemed to lack the flavors that I have gotten in the past . . . and in the crap and lobster rolls . . . we found pieces of shell.  We also ordered a hot plate this trip . . . the teriyaki chicken . . . and the sauce was like water and lacked any teriyaki flavor.

Will I be back . . . not sure . . . I know I will return to the Golden Nugget . . . but only time will tell if I return for sushi.

Happy to recommend this restaurant!
 Happy hour gives you some great options Spicy tuna roll,Salmon avocado roll , and the shrimp Tempura rolls were all fresh.  The miso soup is good . If you like Sake they have a good selection.
A healthy choice while staying at the golden nugget!
We caught the happy hour everyday we stayed in Vegas

Finally decided to stay downtown Vegas and chose the Golden Nugget.  Thought I couldn't go wrong with a resaurant in the hotel and was really looking forward to some good sushi to start and dinner.  After eating the Vegas roll and not being impressed at all.  I didn't even want to spend anymore money here. I went somewhere else for diner. Wouldn't go back.

Red Sushi was a decent place to grab a happy hour snack to hold us over for dinner. We wanted some happy hour drinks and food but after we sat down we saw they only had sake for happy hour, not any of their normal cocktails. We ordered a few sake bombs but they gave us the smallest pour of beer I have ever seen for 4$. The fried chicken and shisito pepper appetizers were tasty but the sushi rolls had too much rice and weren't very flavorful. I'm not sure how dinner is but their happy hour is not that great, we saw better deals at the other Golden Nugget restaurants after we left. The service was friendly and the food came out fast so I appreciated that.

It was late...we were hungry...it was close...it was uninspiring.

There was a hint of fishy smell which should have been a warning, but again - we were hungry!  

We sat down, excited for some sushi.  I ordered some seared tuna to start - I thought it should be like I am used to; melt-in-your-mouth deliciousness.  It could not have been further from that.  The tuna was dry and almost chewy!

A couple of the other rolls we had were okay, but nothing to gush about.  

I felt this was very overpriced.  We will not be back.

My salmon didnt even taste like salmon :( & my rice was super cold. The imitation crab in the rolls tasted like it was straight out of a blender. Prices were double average prices. I usually expect good food out of hotel restaurants in Vegas. This was pretty bad. The seaweed was also very soggy. Never returning

With their prices up there with Nobu I was hoping it would be similar in taste.  Not a chance!!  The miso cod was dry and the salmon ceviche was salmon with onion, tomato, cilantro and oil on a slice of sashimi, no flavor. The wait staff was amazing hence the two stars.  The food is terrible and extremely expensive.

I should know better than to let my Hungrier Half choose the venue. While looking for something quick to eat before a poker tourney at the Nugg, he chose Red Sushi over the Grotto. Big mistake. 

We decided to share a couple things. I ordered the deluxe sushi entree (with a variety of different types of sushi) and he had the misoyaki black cod, salmon and soft shell crab combo. 

We sat at the sushi counter and its the first time I've ever been completely ignored by the sushi chef. And my husband and I...both Japanese, btw. Just saying...it's not like we aren't from the same Motherland, yo. 

He made my sushi entree and without so much as a glance delivered it to the top of the counter and kept on with his work. I pulled it down in front of me and sighed. 

At first glance, I could see the texture of all the fish on the nigiri was VERY grainy, usually a sign of being frozen them thawed. Sigh. But what was almost frightening was what I was *hoping* was NOT supposed to be my maguro nigiri. It was the most interesting shade of brown. Proper etiquette dictates that you generally don't question a sushi chef so I took a bite. Bllleeecccckkkk!! It WAS maguro! At least, it was at some point...maybe a week or two ago. I wouldn't serve that fish blacked, baked, deep fried...nothing. It was nasty! Do you have any idea how hard it is to get the taste of old fish out your mouth?! 

The rest of the fish was barely mediocre, expected. And the rice was verging on not edible.  It was the consistency of porridge that had been aired out a bit. Blehck!

An older Japanese man was sitting alone at the counter next to me and he complained directly to the sushi chef, saying, "this is terrible," and "it's really not so fresh." He told the waitress when he ordered food off the menu that he was doing so because his sushi was so awful but no one seemed to get the hint to comp his sushi or address the issue of the brown slab of ahi in the case.  

I kept wondering how it is possible that the sushi chef himself could serve any of it to customers...any self respecting Japanese would never serve rice THAT mushy or fish that color, much less a Japanese man who calls himself a sushi chef. And the customer even called him out on it...I just shake my head. 

My husband's food was only slightly less repulsive. He was still able to eat it. I was already terrified of their food and sure the cod was old--it had an excessively fishy taste, IMO. 

When the manager swept by asking if everything was alright, I think the look of terror on my face indicated it wasn't. My husband said the sushi was less than stellar. He explained that the rice was mushy and the fish was old. He said he ate most of it but it really was terrible. We still had 3 pieces of the California roll on the plate. He took it away and apologized and said he would only charge us for some. Ahem. The right thing to do when you nearly food poison a customer, Mister? Don't charge them at all. We were charged $12 for a $30 plate of roulette, plus my hubby's food. 

Aside from the bad food, a small group of obnoxiously belligerent men came in from the poker room dropping f-bombs and acting like general jackasses (there was a family with young children sitting right behind them). It further ruined our experience. I don't really know how you handle obnoxious people in Vegas restaurants but it was just uncomfortable for everyone else there. 

When we got home to Hawaii, the first thing we did was eat decent sushi. Still trying to remove the bad taste from our mouths physically. It was THAT bad. 

Will not be returning ever. Ever. Ever. Ever ever ever. Ever.

Got a to go order here. The two rolls were very small in size and overpriced with no sauce or flavor. We also got a miso ramen soup that was overly salty. Take your business elsewhere to another downtown sushi establishment.

Red Sushi is located on your way from the casino into the Rush Tower, its very convenient and not crowded but that might be cause it kinda sucks.
It's harsh, I know.

Diner- "Waiter, there's a fly in my soup"
Waiter- "Serves him right, he's been buzzing around here all day"
Well replace the fly with a hair and the soup with a sushi roll and keep the nonchalant attitude of the waiter.

The boyfriend and I swung by here on our way back from the tables because of the killer happy hour prices. Spicy Tuna Roll and Pork Belly Kushi both priced at $6 and $2 sake bombs? Hard to walk away from a HH menu like that.  The food was mediocre but what you would expect from a small sushi place in a casino. The roll was very small and the pork belly was coated in teriyaki that was very syrupy sweet. The sake bombs were tiny and the beer tasted a lot like cider; it had a very bitter taste.

There are better options inside the Golden Nugget if you're hungry. Probably a lot less hairy too.

Hubby and I wandered in during happy hour last Monday and were pleasantly surprised.  We sat at the sushi bar (he loves sushi and I love him) and checked out their happy hour offerings.  Happy hour is from 4p-6p daily and they offer 3 appetizers, 3 sushi rolls and 3 specialty drinks.

We split the Garlic Chicken appetizer ($5) and it was PLENTY for two people - doubtful one person could have finished it all.  It was amazing - little tender morsels of fried chicken goodness is this tasty sweet and very flavorful sauce.  Served on shredded cabbage which came in quite handy for sopping up all of that amazing sauce!  Well worth the $5....I think I ate about 2/3 of it and he ate the rest and I was FULL!

Hubster ordered yellowtail sashimi and some kind of salmon sashimi and a hot and cold saki.  He said the fish was fresh tasting and the presentation, as always, was beautiful.  I also ordered a non-HH fruity drink but can't remember what it was called!  Tasted good, but I'm not a big fruity drink person.

All in all, the bill came to $64 plus gratuity because we only had the one item from the HH menu.  Service was good, the restaurant was spotless and I'd definitely return, just for the chicken!

First time staying in downtown Las Vegas, usually stay on the Strip. Red Sushi in the Golden Nugget is amazing!  Great quality sushi, very fresh. Great service, helpful when asked a lot of questions. Knowledgeable staff if you aren't an expert at ordering sushi. I will personally recommend this to all of my friends!

We were a party of 10 and we got seated right away. We went during happy hour which was nice because we totally benefited from it. We got our food pretty fast and the service was good. Can't complain the restaurant didn't automatically tack on 18% gratuity which was nice; we still tipped well due to the good service. The food was good and reasonably priced.
Very inexpensive happy hour menu but the staff wasnt very friendly. I wouldnt suggest this place to someone new to eating sushi.....very faced paced environment
This place is pedestrian at best.  Sat at sushi bar and we split 5 rolls.  Fish was not very fresh and service was just OK.  Can't believe it had 5 stars.

I thought it was a good sushi spot, although it had slow service, the food made up for it. I wasn't expecting to find such a nice spot in an old hotel (the Golden Nugget) so was blown away on how modern and delicious they were. Yes I judged the book without opening it lol.

We got there in time for Happy hour specials and had their Garlic Edamame w/garlic flakes appetizer and the fried pork belly (only for my friend lol). My friend said the pork belly tasted like "chicharron" so she liked it. I was more interested in the soybeans J I thought they might be too spicy at first but the sautéed garlic overpowers the spiciness so it was perfectly paired. It was a great start.

We then moved on to their tempura shrimp roll (also on the HH menu) which were really good. You can't go wrong with tempura anything lol. I'm also happy when their HH roll is the same size as a normal size roll. What's the point in paying less and receiving less right?

Next on the menu was our main roll, the Lobster Roll (lobster inside and on top, avocado & cucumbers inside), pricey at $20 for the one roll but, hello, lobster! Loved it! The dynamite sauce was amazing! The only thing I didn't like was that it had too many fish eggs on top. I don't mind a smattering but it was drenched lol.

 

That's all we needed though. We were stuffed after that 2nd roll. Glad we stopped by! Just wish we didn't have to hunt down the waitress every time we needed something.
